reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a perfect location. We only stayed in Singapore for 2 nights so this hotels location was ideal for everything. Right at the top of Orchard road and perfect for shopping !!!!! The rooms were great and hotel staff very helpfull.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: When I just check into the room, it has a very strong smell of smoke, I believe the previous tenant is a heavy smoker. I called up the room service but no one pick up the call. After a few fail attempts, I called up the front desk and made the complaint. I requested to change
reviews.title: Smelly and slow service

reviews.text: the room, but the front desk people promised me after the room service
reviews.title: Good hotel, well located

reviews.text: came in, the smell will be gone. Waited for an hour with no response, I gotto leave the hotel for my event. When I was back to the room at night, the smell never improve, so I repeated the hassle of calling different extension to get the service. After an hour of waiting, the room service came in and simply spray something in the room and walked
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: out. There is no improvement to the situation but I gave up to made another complaint and settle with it.
reviews.title: Impressive

likes.disliked: — The full rack rate on additional 'day rates' when you are on a stop over.

reviews.text: The Orchard hotel is beautiful with very attentive staff. The daily buffets are a feast. Entertainment is good. My only warning is to watch out for deceptive add ons. I was encouraged when checking in to accept a $60/day executive upgrade. This was to include free soft drinks from the mini-bar and daily laundry up to $18/day. Also, access to the Executive lounge. Well when checking out I had been charged for drinking canned green tea from the mini bar and for cleaning services. It was explained that green tea was not considered a soft drink. And all of the daily laundry charges added on were because dry cleaning was not considered a laundry service even though it was under the $18/day allowance. Needless to say I was not pleased since at no time was there any mention that dry cleaning was excluded from the package or I would be charged $6 additional for each can of tea.
reviews.title: Nice but watch out

reviews.text: So overall it was a nice hotel with very misleading promotions.
reviews.title: excellente !!!

likes.disliked: — location at the end of the orchard road

reviews.text: I was just in singapore for a few days for a business trip as well as sidestepping to jb in malaysia and stayed at the orchard hotel. though the hotel is at the end of the orchard road it wasn't such a drag to walk for 7 minutes to the nearest metro station and 5 minutes to the nearest bus station. along the orchard road is the shopping haven for up trend market labels. but for bargain hunters is not that difficult either for the metro station is just 7 minutes walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Property

reviews.text: the hotel itself is superb in furnishing and style. i like especially the bathroom with a rounded see-through glass to the bedroom so you can watch tv while in the tub or just plain tease someone in the bedroom while bathing. lol!
reviews.title: Just OK for Business Trip

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in July 07. I had an executive club room so enjoyed access to the executive lounge upstairs where breakfast was served separately from the rest of the hotel guests, and drinks and finger food are served for nothing between 6 and 8 pm every evening.
reviews.title: Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a 3 night stopover going to Australia and 1 night coming back. We had two very pleasant stays, with a warm welcome each time. The rooms were clean and well equipped, although the room on the first stay (13th floor) was bigger than on the second stay (6th) for the same price. Carpets in both rooms were a bit shabby and there was a slight musty smell that you might expect in a high humidity environment. All staff were very helpful. We didn't eat in the main hotel restaurant as it was a bit expensive and found places to eat elsewhere. There is a Subway and a western/Indonesian cafe within the hotel building, where we had a meal that was rather disappointing. There was a small, quiet shopping arcade here, including a tailor where I had a suit made to measure (in 2 days if you want), at an excellent price and very well made.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.text: All things considered we would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our brochure stated the Orchard Hotel, "offers cosmopolitan elegance and comfort in a great location." I agree!
reviews.title: Excellent location....adequate accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights, but wished we had longer!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good for business travellers

likes.liked: — The hotel itself and the staff

reviews.title: Fab hotel, great location
reviews.text: Great hotel, rooms very modern, comfortable with a touch of luxury and a very good sized TV. (great value for money) Though we didn’t have time to watch TV, too much to see and do in Singapore! This hotel is in a great location, at the top of Orchard Road.
I'd been to Singapore before in 1994, but stayed in the Oriental. That hotel was very good, but geographically, a bit out of it.
reviews.title: Pedestrian, at best...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The agent recommended this place, and on arrival despite the lack of welcoming staff and doors being opened for you, the lobby looked the part. It is attached to the hotel shopping arcade, which like so many in over-subscribed Singapore is a run-down ghost town.
reviews.title: Excellent All-rounder

reviews.text: The room:
reviews.title: Lousy, Filthy, Smelly. Obstinant and Arrogant Staff.
Fantastic in every way
reviews.text: Refurbished in contemporary theme, but with chunks knocked out of the woodwork and a dirty carpet. Kind of an Ikea vibe going on and unfortunately quality of fittings to match...
We were told it was recently refurbished, but it looked rather hammered. Only supplied 2 bath towels & no hand towels. Our room loooked over 2 building sites and the refurb of the pool area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: A good location for the shops on Orchard Road, this large hotel offers everything you need for a comfortable stay. Rooms are comfortable, but not large. There is free WiFi, good showers and a small Room Service Menu (food is OK - nothing special). The same goes for breakfast, where there is a vast buffet and quantity prevails over quality. The Chinese Restaurant is however pretty good. There is also a pool and gym (the equipment is a little old). Staff are efficient, but don't go out of their way. For convenience of location and a quick trip to Singapore, this is a good option. For something memorable, I'd look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: At best this is a 4 star plus hotel but definitely not a 5 star. The service is indeed low and it appears that the training standards leave much to be desired. The location is super but the room and hotel services leave much to desire.A few individuals from the staff stand out and was the redeeming factor otherwise my stay would have been a disaster.
reviews.title: High expectations low experience

reviews.text: I stay at the hotel on business, once a month for 2 weeks at a time. The hotel is generally good but the service on the executive floor is excellent; and I stay in hotels around the world......
reviews.title: Great Executive Floor

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the shopping centre and is generally local to all areas
reviews.title: Great location for shoppers and tourists

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights on my way to Sydney from the UK. It is at the top end of Orchard Rd and the lobby (not so grand when compared to other hotels) has a rear exit that goes straight into one of the malls so you are never tok far away from food! The Orchard MRT station is within easy walking distance too. The rooms are much more modern and up to date than the hotel lobby woyld suggest, more akin to a 5star in the UK. I was travelling alone and had a queen bed, huge shower/bathroom. My one gripes: free wifi in rooms took me ages to connect to on my smart phone and ipad. I wasted a couple of hours trying to sort it out including asking reception to take a look and they couldn't figure it out either. Eventually after a few complaints from me one of the reception guys sorted the problem out though it took him a while! When I booked and clearly stated I wanted a 1 person room, they sold me a queen. Every time I went down for breakfast I was asked whether the other guest (double room) was joining me for breakfast! So, I've paid for 2 peoples breakfast each morning! One morning I went down 15 min before breakfast was about to be closed and it was clearly pointed out to me that they wern't happy I was "late" & made me feel I had to rush & proceeded to clear food away - a bit of a cheek considering my other "guest" never eats there! Also watch out for dodgy reception staff!!! I paid $21 for 35 minute journey during rush hour to get from airport to hotel when I arrived. On deapature I asked for the hotel to hail me a cab. The receptionist said "don't worry all taken care of just go outside". He seemed a bit to smarmy and by the time I got to the airport I realised why.....I was charged $45 for a 15 min journey to airport (it was early)!!! Talk about collusion! That really put a dampner on things & I was lucky I had enough in cash. I won't be staying at that hotel again just because of breakfast and that receptionist and his mate the cabby!!! Bad service in the end. But clean rooms and great location and huge choice at breakfast provided you get there early and don't mind your place being lost every time you get up to top up your plate!
reviews.title: The luxurious hotel.

reviews.text: i was very impressed with the staff and quality of services i got at my stay at orchard hotel Singapore , i stay there from 22nd march to 24th march , i was accompanied by my family of young children , they really enjoyed, i booked a signature club room , what on arrival the hotel staff upgrade to premier club room that was very kind on their part, latterly i enjoyed the evening cocktail and drinks at the hotel club , thanks to the quality manager, for my wonderful experience, regards
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: indeep singh
reviews.title: A hidden gem of a hotel - fantastic stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with my family for three nights. We booked a Club Room as we got a good rate online. Although the hotel is classed as 4 Star its more than this.
reviews.title: Nice but had a poor experience

reviews.text: The service provided was exceptional and the staff went out of thier way to make our 10th wedding anniversary very special.
reviews.title: Expensive for the rate requested

reviews.text: Breakfast was provided in the Club Lounge which was a good spread. But as we were vegetarians the options were slightly limited, however acceptable for us.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: Very good hotel in an excellent location in Singapore, just minutes from the subway stations and the botanical gardens. Very friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet, mediocre fitness center, good pool.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from this hotel -stayed here on our way to and from Oz.We cant find any fault with the hotel excellent service and lovely clean room,excellent base at the top of Orchard road for shopping but also for non shoppers like ourselves.We found the pool area very relaxing after a long day sightseeing.We stayed on a room only basis but found a lovely cafe a 2 min walk from hotel for breakfast -reasonably priced called The Rocky Master.We ate at the Newton Hawker centre and really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.We loved Singapore and would recommend a visit to Sentosa island
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Orchard hotel for eight nights. Room very nice. Clean and comfortable, with good pool and fitness suite.The hotel location is good. Situated at the top of Orchard road, and not to for from the MRT. The main flaw with the hotel is that it lacks atmosphere. It main customers seem to be business people staying for one or two nights. Not a typical holiday hotel. Would recommend this hotel for a couple of nights only. Not suitable for children.
reviews.title: business hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in Singapore overnight on way to Phuket. We had to pay much more than the usual rate as it was Grand Prix time but this did not include breakfast. The breakfast was suppose to be $20 each but we were charged $28. Everything was stone cold - the eggs, bacon and tea and coffee - I do not mean luke warm but freezing.
reviews.title: Breakfast a disgrace!

reviews.text: The rooms were nice and the hotel wasin a good location. The rooms were also very clean.
reviews.title: My all time favourite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night on our way home from a S E Asia holiday and although I was familiar with the hotel I had not actually stayed previously. We were not disappointed and had booked a Club Room to take advantage of the lounge in the evening.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

likes.disliked: — Having to leave as it was the end of our holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in very painless and found the room to be very comfortable. All the usual facilities but no idea which direction we looked out to as I didn't recognise anywhere. Club Lounge was excellent with lots of snack items and freeflow wine and beer from 6 - 8pm. The lounge was also used for breakfast in the morning and the spread was very nice indeed. Freshly cooked eggs available and all the other items from a buffet style display.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Friendly Staff

reviews.text: We would definitely recommend the hotel for a stopover as the location could not be better. At the end of Orchard Road (the main shopping street in Singapore) and access from the hotel directly into a small mall.
reviews.title: Good location but only 3 - 4 star

likes.liked: — location is near Orchard Road shopping
likes.disliked: — it's a nightmare to get a taxi in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great, my husband and I stayed here on our return trip from Australia for two nights, we loved it. The staff in the bar and resturant were supper friendly and very welcoming. The buffet evening meal was lovely, lots of choice and well laid out. I got my hair washed in one of the hairdressers and it was really good, spent a lot of time on it.
reviews.title: "Above Average"

likes.disliked: — Having to leave as it was the end of our holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shopping on Orchard Rd is amazing, but as they are mostly designer goods a bit expensive, I bought some nice jewellery here, half the price than at home.
reviews.title: Look forward to returning

reviews.text: I was there for 4 nights in April 2013 with my friends. We were 6 (girls & boys)
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a beautiful Street

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and nice. The location for hanging out and shopping as awesome. You know the orchard road is the best place for shopping best brands.
reviews.title: Long weekend in Singapore for family

reviews.text: For the food i tried just Chinese and I give them 90/100 but for the breakfast I like to give them 100/100 I liked very much.
reviews.title: Good Priced Hotel in Singapore

reviews.text: A strange thing is the wifi and it's not free in the rooms!!! and the other one is the curtains hanging on the walls for just the architecture.
reviews.title: Near the red district

reviews.text: It has a pool but I didn't have the time for that because the Sentosa took very long time.
reviews.title: Excellent Service to the Duty Manager of Orchard Hotel, Singapore

reviews.text: The cleanliness and service is above par. Staff is cordial. Though a bit towards expensive side, but location is ideal.
reviews.title: Amazing experience !

reviews.text: All malls and market area are close by.
reviews.title: 2nd visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I specially relished the sumptuous buffet breakfast that these people served. January is a nice time to go.
reviews.title: A comfortable oasis on Orchard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second visit to this hotel and stayed for 2 nights at this reasonable hotel. Caught a taxi from the airport for just over $20 for 4 people so for comfort, convenience and time to hotel was quite good. I booked 2 rooms and upon arrival requested to have them next to each other which they were able to service promptly. I was told for whatever reason our rooms were upgraded for the room only but not the extra services with the room, i was happy with that. Upon entering the room, the bathroom was relatively clean like the rest of the room but did show some wear and tear but no big fuss. Tv reception was bad in room 1543, called reception and a guy came to fix the connection. Picture was still fuzzy but i guess bearable as we were not watching tv all day. Toiletries like tooth brush, paste, shower cap was supplied. Other than that the room was quite comfortable and quiet and sleep well and the upgraded room was not a bad size. Would I return? I can see myself there for a third time.
reviews.title: A Warm & Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights before my work put me into another hotel closer to the office. We thought it was a lovely hotel overall we had a pleasant stay. We stayed in a Club Signature Room with access to the Club lounge daily for breakfast, daily refreshments and happy hour. The room is presented in beautifully oriental décor, a blue theme with ginger jars, blue floral wallpaper. The bed was a little firm for our liking, the bathroom was spacious but there was not much of a view from the room, which is a bit of a let down!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I booked a room for 1 night in the weekend rate
reviews.title: slightly feel better bcoz...

reviews.text: for 3 people
reviews.title: Worth It!

reviews.text: check in was very very slow about 20 minutes while I was
reviews.title: Over Priced

likes.liked: — Close to where i needed to e

reviews.text: speaking to the counter
reviews.title: Pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: because they said I need to pay for extra bed
reviews.title: Superior suites good

likes.disliked: — The fact they never offered my security back

reviews.text: We recently returned from a short 2 night stay at the Orchard Hotel. We chose it because it was a short distance from the Thai Embassy where we had to renew our visas (we live in Bangkok).
reviews.title: Dreadful place - won't ever stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All we can say is...dreadful...and we'll never EVER stay there again. Firstly, my husband's company booked it and asked for a large deluxe as we were travelling with 2 small children (3 & 1). Upon arrival we were told we could have a larger room but wait for 45 mins. Ok, we thought if it's worth it. Complimentary drinks whilst waiting, but, only if you had red wine or beer...
reviews.title: Good for a short stay

reviews.text: Told it was a corner room, get there and it had a tiny L shaped corridor that led to the smallest deluxe room we'd ever seen. Annoyed, we asked for the bigger room we were promised and were fobbed off by a junior who said that the Orchard does have the smallest rooms in Singapore! There was no where to put our travel cot and you couldn't swing a cat in it. Finally the duty manager arrives, and very rudly said this was the best they could do unless we were prepared to pay more. After tense arguments, they moved us to a twin room which was much bigger which proved they had the rooms all along. All of this took 3 hours by which time our children were going nuts.
reviews.title: losing its shine !

reviews.text: Next morning we head to breakfast only to be told there were no tables free, there was a queue and could we come back in 10 minutes! We have never been asked to wait for breakfast in a hotel in which we are staying. With 2 small kids you cannot wait. So after much hasseling we got a table. Breakfast was less than impressive. Service appaling.
reviews.title: Three strikes, so they are O-U-T

reviews.text: Lifts that close so quickly one of our strollers with our 3 yr old sat in got caught in the doors.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the Orchard Hotel as part of a SIA stopover package. The hotel is in a great location easy access to attractions, shopping and restaurants
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We arrived early in the morning after a long flight and we were given a room immediately, we requested a non-smoking room, however the room smelled like someone chain smoked in there for about 2 years. The carpet was filthy with big black stains all over. I found this inexcusable and disgusting. I assume management doesn't read TA reviews because I know smelly rooms and dirty carpets have previously been mentioned. I did report my observations to the management before leaving, whatever that's worth.
reviews.title: Good location, average hotel

likes.disliked: — noise insulation in rooms, uncomfortable beds

reviews.text: Breakfast was good and was included with our package.
reviews.title: Good hotel after reception

reviews.text: The public areas of the hotel appeared to be clean and well kept and I found the staff to be helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: What you'd expect from a large hotel
Excellent hotel, great location.
reviews.text: I have been to this hotel a few times now and would not hesitate in returning. I stayed at the hotel with the Singapore Stopover, before travelling on to Australia. Also stayed on the return journey. This is a wonderful hotel situated at the top of the famous shopping street, Orchard Road. Excellent location. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. There are bell-boys who take your luggage to your room.
The rooms are very nice at the hotel, especially the en suites. Each room has a large TV which had a few decent channels on, including news and music channels.
reviews.title: Decent but not spectacular - a typical business hotel

reviews.text: The buffet food is fantastic at the Orchard Cafe, there is always a wide selection of foods and it is of very high quality. They also offer A La Carte, which is also delicious. The room service is very good too.
reviews.title: a classy resort

likes.liked: — standard of rooms was excellent. had a real classy, cosmipolitan charm.
likes.disliked: — service was somewhat lacking. Front desk was increadibly slow.

reviews.text: The hotel has a swimming pool, fully-equiped gym, sauna, potting green, giant chess set and a dart board. The swimming pool is idyllic with a gorgeous cascading waterfall. There is also a small slide for young children.
reviews.title: What you expect... little else...

likes.disliked: — No free internet and no wi-fi in room

reviews.text: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 2 weeks in Feb. while on a buisness project. The hotel is located right at the end of bustling Orchard Rd. near most of the expensive designer shops and malls. I arrived very early in the morning and had no difficulties checking in and getting to my room. The hotel is divided into 2 wings with one being a little older than the other. I was in the older wing, but thought the room was very tasteful and modern. The rooms are a bit on the small side by American standards, but are still nice. I found the bathroom especially interesting as there is large round window between the bath/shower and the living area of the room. The only complaints about the room are that you can not adjust the temperature even though there is a thermostat in each room. They keep the air conditioning in the rooms set very cold! The other issue was that the carpet in the room was very dirty and didn't look like it had been cleaned in years. There is a very nice buffet for breakfast with lots of food selections to suit people of all tastes. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but I did not ever eat at it. Room service is offered 24hrs a day and has a pretty good selection, although I never found the food to be that good. There is also a lounge area in the lobby with live music everynight except Sunday. The same group sings there everynight, and although they try, they just aren't very good. The hotel will be going to all non-smoking rooms by March 2007, but smoking is allowed in the lounge area. There is an outdoor pool on the 4th floor which is very nice and some of the rooms in both wings overlook it. You are also able to get Tiger or Corona beer around the pool if you can find the wait staff. They tend to disappear from the pool area during the day. The hotel is connected to a shopping center that has mostly food shops. There is a Subway and Tony Roma's restaurant as well as a money exchange booth that keep good hours. At night, right accross the street there are prostitutes that pick up men in the bars in the shopping center next to the hotel. I went out a few times in the evening as a lone female and never felt threatened, but it was somewhat unfavorable to see next to the hotel. The area is very safe and there are always people out walking around. Overall the hotel sees a lot of business travelers and seems to be busy all the time. I don't know that I would stay here again if I ever came back to Singapore for holiday, but the hotel was ok by me.
reviews.title: Orchard was OK
OK but not great for lone female travellers
reviews.text: The hotel was fine at check in but I was told they did not have a double bed just a single. This struck me later as odd. I did not realise the heat and immediately walked towards the shops to buy a dress for my business meetings the next day. As you turn to head down orchard there were a lot of Benches with men on them and I thought I heard a few comments. It struck me as off as I was told it was very female friendly and safe for women here. I returned and decided to have a drink in the lobby arounf 9pm with a magazine and my book. Very frosty reception from the waitress and felt like i was being watched by a table of men beside me who were not singaporean. My colleague the next day told me that after 10pm Prostitutes sit on the Benches outside and get picked up in a cab from the hotel. An Aussie lady I met on the way to the airport told me she had a drink the night before and a group of men were pointing at her. Did they think we were working gals??? She also had two singles and somone above her kept making noise all night. Maybe the double are for "other customers". Travelling for business alone I will not be staying here again. On the other side the hotel was VERY clean but the food was average. Breakfast was the better meal I had here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 Nights in 2004 and loved the hotel. The location is great as its on the busy Orchard Rd shopping area with easy access to the MRT and transport links.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was awesome and the rooms were great too.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Horrible customer service

likes.disliked: — Customer service, the rooms, lack of cleansliness
